Article Headline.Headline Text: Coke sales surge in Q2 as re-openings gain momentum

keypoint_1.Keypoint Text: The Atlanta-based soft drink giant said its revenue jumped 42 per cent to US$10.1 billion in the April-June period. That was well ahead of the US$9.3 billion in sales that Wall Street had forecast, according to analysts polled by FactSet.

keypoint_2.Keypoint Text: It was a very different story than the second quarter of 2020, when Coke's sales sank 28 per cent. Coke said sales of its trademark Coca-Cola are now running ahead of 2019 levels thanks to growing demand in Europe, Africa and Latin America.
